name: Cannibis sativa
Relationship: Compare: Hedysarum - Brazilian Burdock - (Gonorrhea and inflammation of penis); Canth.; Apis; Copaiva; Thuj.; Kal. nit.Antidotes: Camph.; Lemon juice.

Heart: Painful strokes and tension with palpitation
Sensation as if drops were falling from the heart
Eyes: Cataract from nervous disturbances, abuse of alcohol and tobacco; patient feels deeply approaching blindness
Pressure from back of eyes, forward
Respiratory: Weight on chest; rattling wheezing breathing
Cough, with green viscid, also bloody, expectoration
Oppression of breathing and palpitation; must stand up
Urine: Inflamed sensation, with soreness to touch
Gonorrhea, acute stage; urethra very sensitive
Urine scalding, with spasmodic closure of sphincter
Stoppage of urethra by mucus and pus
Burning while urinating, extending to bladder
Head: Pressure on root of nose
Lectophobia
Vertigo; sensation of dropping water on head
Female: Amenorrhoea when physical powers have been overtaxed, also with constipation
Extremities: Contraction of fingers after a sprain
Feet feel heavy on going upstairs
Dislocation of patella on going upstairs
Affections of the ball of the foot and under part of toes

details: Seems to affect especially the urinary, sexual, and respiratory organs. It has characteristic sensations as of dropping water. Great fatigue, as from over-exertion; weary after meals. Choking in swallowing; things go down the wrong way. STUTTERING. Confusion of thought and speech. Wavering speech, hasty, incoherent.
